net.sf.mmm.util.validation.base

Class ValidatorRange<V extends Comparable<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.validation.base.AbstractValidator<V>
      • net.sf.mmm.util.validation.base.AbstractValueValidator<V>
        • net.sf.mmm.util.validation.base.ValidatorRange<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - is the generic type of the value to validate.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueValidator<V>

    public class ValidatorRange<V extends Comparable<V>>
extends AbstractValueValidator<V>
    This is a ValueValidator that validates that a given value is within a specific Range.
    Since:
    3.1.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • validateNotNull

        protected NlsMessage validateNotNull(V value)
        This method performs the validation in case value is NOT null. This method contains the actual custom logic for the validation. It is therefore designed in a way that makes it most simple to implement custom validators.
        ATTENTION:
        For internationalization you should not directly return string literals but use NlsMessage instead.
        Specified by:
        validateNotNull in class AbstractValueValidator<V extends Comparable<V>>
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to validate.
        Returns:
        the failure message or null if the the given value is valid.
